column2: I have shown great heroism in this glorious victory! My prestige has greatly increased!

Dear [Root.GetTitledName], I have decided to institute the [From.GetProposedLaw] Law in the [From.Holder.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. All that is needed is the support of yourself and my other loyal vassals. I look forward to know your decision on this urgent matter.\n\nYour [From.Holder.GetTitle]
Approve the institution of the [From.GetProposedLaw] Law.
Ignore this request for now...
Today, the morning is the bringer of good news!\nMy wife [From.GetFirstName] thinks she is with child!
Excellent.
Praise God and His Saints!
I should provide immediately...

After my scolding of the priest, I left fuming with anger and was ready to slap whoever it was that touched my arm to stop me. In front of me stood [From.GetTitledFirstName], who told me that the priest certainly deserved the scolding, given all I had done for him.
I would be content with visiting the local church once in a while, but if I don't show up the priest scolds me and tells me I should set a better example for my subjects.
I guess I should listen to him...
I could not care less.
The greedy priests of the land always need more gold for their rites, but I have deep pockets and after all it's for a good cause...
I hope [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] can see this.
My everyday tasks as [Root.GetTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are getting more and more boring. Even conversations with my courtiers bore me. I need something new and exciting in my life...
I will go hunting in the woods...
Disastrous Hunt
Fortunate Hunt
Perhaps I should become a falconer...
Disastrous Falconry
Fortunate Falconry
The day spent in the woods hunting was a huge disappointment. There was no prey in sight, and in the end my horse even threw me off...
Forget it! This is enough!
Maybe I should try falconry instead...
Maybe I should try hunting instead...
I don't feel too well, something is wrong with me. I am burning up with fever, my nose is running and my head feels as if someone is banging something hard against it.
Let us hope it will pass quickly...
Pain is a blessed reminder of our Lord's Passion.

An old wound is aggravating and getting more and more painful every day. The local priest offered himself to assist me and dressed the wound with a mixture of healing herbs, but his remedies have proven ineffective so far...
May [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] have mercy on me...
The disease is gone.\nAnd I am alive...
I am alive!

Your horse has always struck you as being of a dependable sort, a quality you feel is sorely lacking in your councillors. Time to shake things up a bit. You will appoint him as your new [Root.GetChancellorName].
column3: Votre cheval est d'une fiabilité à toute épreuve, qualité qui fait cruellement défaut à vos conseillers, selon vous. Il est temps de remettre un peu d'ordre autour de vous. Vous décidez d'en faire le nouveau [Root.GetChancellorName].
column4: Euer Pferd schien Euch schon immer eine besonders vertrauenswürdige Kreatur zu sein – was Ihr von Euren Ratsmitgliedern leider nicht immer sagen konntet. Höchste Zeit, für etwas frischen Wind zu sorgen! Euer treues Ross soll Euer neuer [Root.GetChancellorName]
column6: Tu caballo siempre ha mostrado ser digno de confianza, cualidad que crees muy escasa entre tus consejeros. Es hora de cambiar las cosas por aquí. Lo nombrarás tu nuevo [Root.GetChancellorName].

column2: Incitatus, I appoint thee as the [Root.GetChancellorName] of the realm.
column3: Sabot-luisant, je fais de toi le nouveau [Root.GetChancellorName] du royaume.
column4: Glitzerhuf, als Euer Fürst ernennen Wir Euch zum [Root.GetChancellorName] des Reiches.
column6: Pezuña Brillante, yo os nombro [Root.GetChancellorName] del reino.

column2: Llamrei, I appoint thee as the [Root.GetChancellorName] of the realm.
column3: Sabot-luisant, je fais de toi le nouveau [Root.GetChancellorName] du royaume.
column4: Glitzerhuf, als Euer Fürst ernennen Wir Euch zum [Root.GetChancellorName] des Reiches.
column6: Pezuña Brillante, yo os nombro [Root.GetChancellorName] del reino.

column2: Your mad [Root.Liege.GetTitle] has decided, in [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] infinite wisdom, to relieve you of your post as [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName]. Incitatus, [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] beloved horse, will be taking your place.
column3: Votre [Root.Liege.GetTitle] extravagant a décidé, dans son infinie sagesse, de vous retirer de votre fonction de [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName]. Sabot-luisant, son cheval bien aimé, a été nommé à votre place.
column4: Euer geisteskranker [Root.Liege.GetTitle] hat als weiser [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] beschlossen, Euch als [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName] abzusetzen. Glitzerhuf, das Pferd Eures [Root.Liege.GetHerHis]s wird künftig Euren Platz einnehmen.
column6: Tu enloquecido [Root.Liege.GetTitle] ha decidido, en [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] infinita sabiduría, relevarte de tu puesto como [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName]. Pezuña de Oro, [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] amado caballo, ocupará tu lugar.

column2: Your mad [Root.Liege.GetTitle] has decided, in [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] infinite wisdom, to relieve you of your post as [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName]. [event_target:horse_chancellor_target.GetFirstName], [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] beloved horse, will be taking your place.
column3: Votre [Root.Liege.GetTitle] extravagant a décidé, dans son infinie sagesse, de vous retirer de votre fonction de [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName]. Sabot-luisant, son cheval bien aimé, a été nommé à votre place.
column4: Euer geisteskranker [Root.Liege.GetTitle] hat als weiser [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] beschlossen, Euch als [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName] abzusetzen. Glitzerhuf, das Pferd Eures [Root.Liege.GetHerHis]s wird künftig Euren Platz einnehmen.
column6: Tu enloquecido [Root.Liege.GetTitle] ha decidido, en [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] infinita sabiduría, relevarte de tu puesto como [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName]. Pezuña de Oro, [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] amado caballo, ocupará tu lugar.

column2: You are forced through the indignity of watching as Incitatus is led into the council chambers and appointed [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName].
column3: On vous inflige le spectacle indigne de Sabot-luisant intégrant le conseil municipal sous sa nouvelle fonction de [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName].
column4: Ihr seid gezwungen, Glitzerhufs feierlicher Amtseinführung beizuwohnen und zuzuschauen, wie er als neuer [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName] eingesetzt wird.
column6: Te obligan a sufrir la humillación de ver cómo Pezuña de Oro es escoltado hasta la Sala del Consejo y nombrado [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName].

column2: You are forced through the indignity of watching as [event_target:horse_chancellor_target.GetFirstName] is led into the council chambers and appointed [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName].
column3: On vous inflige le spectacle indigne de Sabot-luisant intégrant le conseil municipal sous sa nouvelle fonction de [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName].
column4: Ihr seid gezwungen, Glitzerhufs feierlicher Amtseinführung beizuwohnen und zuzuschauen, wie er als neuer [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName] eingesetzt wird.
column6: Te obligan a sufrir la humillación de ver cómo Pezuña de Oro es escoltado hasta la Sala del Consejo y nombrado [Root.Liege.GetChancellorName].

column2: This time that maniac has gone too far...
column3: Cette fois, ce fou furieux est allé trop loin…
column4: Dieses Mal hat dieser Wahnsinnige den Bogen überspannt!
column6: Esta vez ese maniaco ha ido demasiado lejos...

column2: Long life to them... in the Bottomless Pit!
Return [From.GetHerHim] to [From.GetHerHis] quarters.
Throw [From.GetHerHim] back in [From.GetHerHis] cell.
Throw [From.GetHerHim] in the Bottomless Pit!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] sent me to the Bottomless Pit!
My prisoner, [From.GetBestName], is complaining about [From.GetHerHis] dark cell in the dungeon, asking for more suitable accommodations...
Ridiculous. Let [From.GetObjectPronoun] rot.
Very well, I shall be merciful.
Suitable? Throw him in the Bottomless Pit!
Cruel [Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] decided I should be forgotten in the Bottomless Pit! This is the end of me...
Your Tribal vassal, [From.GetTitledName], has adopted Urbanism.
My wife [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] has grown old and less than attractive. Maybe a young concubine will bring some excitement to my life?
I am sure my wife will allow me to indulge myself.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] tries to seduce [This.GetTitledFirstName]
She will probably not find out...
No, adultery is a sin!

Dear [Root.GetBestName], I hereby invite you to the grand feast in [From.Location.GetName]. Your presence at the feast would be greatly appreciated and I look forward to your attendance.\n\n[From.GetTitledFirstName]
I will gladly travel to the feast.
I will not attend.
There is an infidel in my liege [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s court.
Demand to liege that the infidel should be burned at the stake.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] decides if the infidel should be burned at the stake or not...
Demand to liege that the infidel should be exiled.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] decides if the infidel should be exiled or not...

My [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [From.GetTitledFirstName] told me in confidence that among our courtiers there is an infidel with dangerous beliefs.\n'I recommend you set an example and burn the infidel on the stake!' [From.GetSheHe] said.
Yes, the infidel must be burned at the stake!
No. I will do no such thing.
[Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [From.GetTitledFirstName] found an infidel at my court and insisted, or more precisely demanded, that I would banish the misbeliever on pain of death.
Indeed. The infidel will be banished.
No. I will not banish anyone.
I watched gleefully as the infidel burned at the stake. The infidel will burn in the [Root.Religion.GetName] Hell as it burns now until the sins has burned from its soul.
No more false religions.
Despite my demands, warnings and even pleas, [From.GetTitledFirstName] refused to burn the infidel at the stake.
This is troubling news...
The infidel was banished from the lands of [From.GetTitledFirstName] and forced to never return on pain of death.
This is excellent news!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] chose to ignore my demands. The infidel I had found was not even banished and was let go without any punishment.
This is troubling news...

There is a dangerous misbeliever in my liege [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s court. As [Root.Liege.GetLordSpiritualName], my duty is to inform [Root.Liege.GetHerHim] immediately and suggest a proper solution...
Demand to liege that the heretic should be burned at the stake.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] decides if the heretic should be burned at the stake or not...
Demand to liege that the heretic should be exiled.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] decides if the heretic should be exiled or not...

My [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [From.GetTitledFirstName] told me in confidence that among our courtiers there is a heretic with dangerous beliefs.\n'I recommend you set an example and burn the misbeliever on the stake!' [From.GetSheHe] said.
The heretic will burn. It is the will of God.
No one will be burned at the stake. Are you insane?
[Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [From.GetTitledFirstName] found a heretic at my court and insisted, or more precisely demanded, that I would banish the misbeliever on pain of death.
Indeed. The heretic will be banished.
No. I will not do this.
The heretic must have regretted his sins as he burned at the stake. This will be an excellent warning who challenges the one true faith, the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.
Burn.
What good is my position as [From.GetLordSpiritualName] if my liege won't listen to me? The heretic did not burn on the stake despite my desperate demands to [From.GetTitledFirstName].
This is troubling news...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] banished the heretic on pain of death if he would ever return.
It is the will of God.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] ignored my demands about banishing the heretic.
This is troubling news...

[Root.GetTreasurerName] [Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName] wants to hire a group of thugs and hoodlums to intimidate the locals who are not paying their taxes. [Root.job_treasurer.GetSheHeCap] seems to be sure this is the most effective approach to the problem.
[Root.job_treasurer.GetSheHeCap] can do what [Root.job_treasurer.GetSheHe] wants, as long as taxes are entering the treasury.
Prevent the [Root.GetTreasurerName] from doing any harm. We can afford it.
Intimidate the people? I will never agree to that!
Intimidate? Not enough! Arrest whoever has not paid their taxes!

[Root.GetTreasurerName] [Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName] has had some interesting ideas on how to improve the administration of our treasury and increase the trading of imported wares through the land.
I trust [Root.job_treasurer.GetHerHim]. Adopt the [Root.GetTreasurerName]'s ideas.
Too expensive. It's not worth it.

[Root.GetMarshalName] [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] told me about [Root.job_marshal.GetHerHis] ideas about the storage and transport of supplies for our soldiers. I couldn't really understand what [Root.job_marshal.GetSheHe] was talking about, but [Root.job_marshal.GetSheHe] was adamant in [Root.job_marshal.GetHerHis] belief that this would improve our effectiveness on the field of battle.
I trust [Root.job_marshal.GetHerHim]. Adopt the [Root.GetMarshalName]'s ideas.
An expensive idea, too. It's not worth it.
The farmers, the priests and the feudal lords all claim the right to spoils from shipwrecks that capsize outside of [Root.GetName]. The rights to the spoils will be given to...
...the priests.
...the commoners.
...the feudal Lords.
...the Crown!

Through the machinations of a secret conspiracy of noblemen, [From.GetTitledName] has been forced to abdicate one of [From.GetHerHis] titles. After much deliberation, the lords of the realm have finally managed to agree on you as the least offensive candidate for the title. Congratulations, [From.GetTitle].
Is this my last breath...?
Soon I will cross the sword brigde, and feast in the Otherworld.
May God have mercy on my soul.
Soon I will be feasting among Gods in the Valhöll.
I have lived my life with honor.
A Legendary Sword

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] has decreed that the ancient family sword, 'Excalibur', also known as 'Caledfwylch', one of the thirteen legendary Treasures of Britain, shall be bestowed upon you. Use it with wisdom.
It shall be done.

You realize one day that you do not feel as vibrant or capable as you used to be. After all, you are elderly now, having lived many decades. People only live so long, and sooner or later, you, too, will die and join your forefathers in the afterlife...
Indeed. But with age also comes wisdom...

Under the rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has had more than ten years of undisturbed peace. Memories of war and battles are fading away, and vassals and courtiers are devoting themselves more and more to administration, politics and plotting, rather than to martial duties.
May this land never suffer the cruelty of war again.

Under the rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has had more than fifteen years of undisturbed peace. Memories of war and battles are fading away, and vassals and courtiers are devoting themselves more and more to administration, politics and plotting, rather than to martial duties.
May this land never suffer the cruelty of war again.

Under the rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has had more than twenty years of undisturbed peace. Memories of war and battles are fading away, and vassals and courtiers are devoting themselves more and more to administration, politics and plotting, rather than to martial duties.
May this land never suffer the cruelty of war again.
The Siege of [Root.Siege.GetName]
The Siege of [Root.Siege.GetName]
The Siege of [Root.Siege.GetName]
The Siege of [Root.Siege.GetName]
The Siege of [Root.Siege.GetName]
The Siege of [Root.Siege.GetName]
The Siege of [Root.Siege.GetName]
The Siege of [Root.Siege.GetName]
The Siege of [Root.Siege.GetName]
The Siege of [Root.Siege.GetName]
A blow was struck.
A blow was struck.
Surrender comes sooner.
Surrender comes sooner.
It was necessary.

Treachery, ever the bane of a defending garrison. The word is out someone has made contact with the attackers. Only a few know for sure the rest it is a matter of speculation. The defenders of [From.Siege.GetName] are sure that this move means their days are numbered.
A seed is planted...

Large numbers of people in a confined area is never healthy. The risk of disease is ever present. Unsanitary conditions have led to just such an outbreak. Already the commander of the siege of [From.Siege.GetName] is working to mitigate the problem but the damage is done.
The attack weakens...

The spectre of hunger is an ever present fear for the defenders. The cruel arithmetic of a siege means that as defenders of [From.Siege.GetName] starve to death there is more food for those that remain.

The walls are long and constant vigilance is impossible, and enterprising traders know that a city under siege is a ripe market for food. One such trader managed to succeed in smuggling through some food. Although nowhere near sufficient to sustain the garrison  of [From.Siege.GetName], it brings fresh heart to the defenders.
The siege lengthens...

Paradoxically a siege camp is a ripe target for bandits - although there may be lots of soldiers there, they are all looking the wrong way. A series of raids have lead to some loss of life amongst the attackers of [From.Siege.GetName] as they attempted to repel them.
Damn them!
I was captured during the siege of [From.GetName] by [From.GetTitledName] and am now [From.GetHerHis] prisoner.
Curses!
[From.GetTitledName] was captured during the siege of [FromFrom.GetName] and is now my prisoner.
Good.

[From.GetBestName] claims that [From.GetSheHe] would be a better military advisor than [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName], and petitions that [From.GetSheHe] should be given the title of [Root.GetMarshalName] of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
I agree. [From.GetSheHeCap] shall be appointed as [Root.GetMarshalName].
We should give [Root.job_marshal.GetFirstName] a chance to improve.
Enough! I rule in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]!
Very well. [From.GetSheHeCap] shall be appointed as [Root.GetMarshalName].

[From.GetBestName] claims that [From.GetSheHe] would be a better advisor in matters of deception and intrigue than [Root.job_spymaster.GetTitledFirstName], and petitions that [From.GetSheHe] should be given the title of [Root.GetSpymasterName] of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
I agree. [From.GetSheHeCap] shall be granted a seat in the Council.
We should give [Root.job_spymaster.GetTitledFirstName] a chance to improve.
Very well. [From.GetSheHeCap] shall be granted a seat in the Council.
Enough! I rule in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]!

[From.GetBestName] claims that [From.GetSheHe] would be a better advisor in matters of trade and administration than [Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName], and petitions that [From.GetSheHe] should be given the title of [Root.GetTreasurerName] of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
I agree. [From.GetSheHeCap] shall be granted a seat in the Council.
Not yet. Give [Root.job_treasurer.GetFirstName] a chance to improve.
Enough! I rule in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]!
Very well. [From.GetSheHeCap] shall be granted a seat in the Council.

[From.GetBestName] claims that [From.GetSheHe] would be a better religious and spiritual advisor than [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName], and petitions that [From.GetSheHe] should be given the title of [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] and granted a seat in the Council of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
I agree. [From.GetSheHeCap] shall be appointed as [Root.GetLordSpiritualName].
Not yet. [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] deserves a chance to improve.
I rule in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]!
Very well. [From.GetSheHeCap] shall be our [Root.GetLordSpiritualName].

[From.GetBestName] claims that [From.GetSheHe] would be a better diplomat and advisor than [Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName], and petitions that [From.GetSheHe] should be given the title of [Root.GetChancellorName] of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
I agree. [From.GetSheHeCap] shall be appointed as [Root.GetChancellorName].
Give [Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName] a chance to improve.
Enough! I will hear no more of this!
Very well. [From.GetSheHeCap] shall be appointed as [Root.GetChancellorName].

[Root.GetChancellorName] [Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName] has done a superb job so far. Today a merchant from [Root.Location.GetName] requested my support in a dispute with a feudal lord from the local manor. I shall send my [Root.GetChancellorName] [Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName] to try and solve the dispute between them, but if no agreement can be found, who should I favor?
The merchant!
The feudal lord!

[Root.GetMarshalName] [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] has done a superb job so far, and everyone seems to like [Root.job_marshal.GetHerHim]. I am deciding between sending [Root.job_marshal.GetHerHim] to heighten the morale of the troops, or to recruit and train more levies.
Send [Root.job_marshal.GetHerHim] to heighten the morale of our warriors.
Order the [Root.GetMarshalName] to recruit and train more levies.

[Root.GetChancellorName] [From.GetTitledFirstName] is not performing as well as expected, [From.GetHerHis] slothfulness makes [From.GetHerHim] go to extreme lenghts to avoid having to do any actual work. Something must be done.
I will confront [Root.GetChancellorName] [From.GetTitledFirstName].
Wait. Let us give [From.GetHerHim] one last chance to sharpen up.
This can not be tolerated! Seize and imprison the [Root.GetChancellorName]!

[Root.GetTreasurerName] [Root.job_treasurer.GetFirstName] probably did not think I would notice a few coins missing, but the steady disappearance made me suspicious. Might it be that the gold is disappearing into [Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName]'s pockets?
Question the [Root.GetTreasurerName] about the missing gold.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] is questioned by [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
I do not really care about this. Leave [Root.job_treasurer.GetFirstName] be.

I found some more evidence [Root.GetTreasurerName] [From.GetTitledFirstName] had stolen the money and confronted [From.GetHerHim] with it. [From.GetSheHeCap] confessed and begged me to be just with my punishment.
You will return the gold you stole, [From.GetFirstName], and more.
Guards! Imprison the [Root.GetTreasurerName] and lock [From.GetHerHim] up in chains!
I shall be merciful. [From.GetFirstName] will be forgiven...

You have decided to join your personal guard in their daily training at dawn. Things were a bit stiff at first, but when they realized you wouldn't have them beheaded for scoring hits on you with their wooden practise swords, they taught you many valuable lessons. Your martial skill has improved.
They are good lads. A morning well spent!

You have been studying the art of mounted combat under the tutelage of a skilled local horseman. The bruises you have incurred from falling off your horse will heal in time and they are a small price to pay for your increased horsemanship.
Excellent.
Maxima Ceasariensis inactive
For whatever reason, Maxima Ceasriensis has become inactive when it shouldn't have.
Uh oh...
Flavia Ceasariensis inactive
For whatever reason, Flavia Ceasriensis has become inactive when it shouldn't have.
Uh oh...
Britannia Prima inactive
For whatever reason, Britannia Prima has become inactive when it shouldn't have.
Uh oh...
Britannia Secunda inactive
For whatever reason, Britannia Secunda has become inactive when it shouldn't have.
Uh oh...
Valentia inactive
For whatever reason, Valentia has become inactive when it shouldn't have.
Uh oh...
You are thrown between waves of chills and sweats. Food has lost its appeal and no amount of sleep seems to remedy your fatigue. It seems you have contracted the Saxon Plague.
column3: Vous alternez entre des moments de frissons et des moments de sueurs. La nourriture a perdu son attrait et aucun sommeil, aussi long soit-il, ne semble remédier à votre fatigue. Vous avez contracté la consomption.
column4: Ihr schwankt zwischen Schüttelfrost und Hitzewallungen. Speisen haben jeglichen Reiz verloren und keine Menge an Schlaf lindert Eure Erschöpfung. Ihr habt Schwindsucht.
column6: Te mueves entre golpes de sudor y escalofríos. La comida ha dejado de interesarte y no dejas de estar cansado por mucho que duermas. Has contraído la Tisis.

column2: These are dark days. My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has been growing weaker and weaker over the last few weeks and I have just been informed that [From.GetHerHis] affliction is indeed the Saxon Plague.
column3: Les temps sont durs. M[From.GetHerHis] [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] est devenu[From.GetNoneE] de plus en plus faible ces dernières semaines et je viens d'apprendre que son affliction est en fait la consomption.
column4: Dies sind finstere Tage. Mein [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] ist in den letzten Wochen zunehmend schwächer geworden, und ich habe gerade erfahren, dass es sich bei [From.GetHerHis] Krankheit fürwahr um Schwindsucht handelt.
column6: Son días oscuros. Mi [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], se ha debilitado en las últimas semanas y acaban de informarme que su enfermedad es claramente el agotamiento.

column2: You awake rejuvenated. After some moments of disbelief you realize that your fever has passed and your appetite has returned. You have survived the Saxon Plague.
column3: Vous vous réveillez plus jeune. Après des moments d'incrédulité, vous réalisez que votre fièvre a cessé et que vous avez retrouvé votre appétit. Vous avez survécu à la consomption.
column4: Ihr erwacht ausgeruht. Nach einem Augenblick der Ungläubigkeit wird Euch klar, dass Euer Fieber abgeklungen und Euer Appetit zurückgekehrt ist. Ihr habt die Schwindsucht überlebt.
column6: Despiertas rejuvenecido. Tras unos momentos de incredulidad te das cuenta que la fiebre ha pasado y has recuperado el apetito. Has sobrevivido a la Tisis.

column2: [From.GetTitledName] is fairly sure you are developing the Saxon Plague. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.
column3: [From.GetTitledName] a presque la certitude que vous avez la consomption. [From.GetSheHeCap] insiste pour que vous suiviez ses instructions.
column4: [From.GetTitledName] ist sich recht sicher, dass Ihr Anzeichen von Schwindsucht zeigt. [From.GetSheHeCap] gibt Euch Anweisungen und besteht darauf, dass Ihr sie befolgt.
column6: [From.GetTitledName] está bastante seguro/a que has contraído Tisis. [From.GetSheHeCap] insiste que sigas [From.GetHerHis]s instrucciones.

column2: [From.GetTitledName] thinks you sound rather horse and is concerned that you may be developing the Saxon Plague. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.
column3: [From.GetTitledName] dit que vous avez une fièvre de cheval et s'inquiète que vous puissiez avoir contracté la consomption. [From.GetSheHeCap] insiste pour que vous suiviez ses instructions.
column4: [From.GetTitledName] findet, Eure Stimme klänge heiser und befürchtet, dass Ihr Anzeichen von Schwindsucht zeigen könntet. [From.GetSheHeCap] gibt Euch Anweisungen und besteht darauf, dass Ihr sie befolgt.
column6: [From.GetTitledName] cree que sueno bastante ronco y le preocupa que haya contraído Tisis. [From.GetSheHeCap] insiste que sigas [From.GetHerHis]s instrucciones.

column2: [From.GetTitledName] states that [From.GetHerHis] extensive medical experience leads [From.GetHerHim] to the certain conclusion that you are developing the Saxon Plague. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.
column3: [From.GetTitledName] affirme que sa vaste expérience l'amène à la certitude que vous avez la consomption. [From.GetSheHeCap] insiste pour que vous suiviez ses instructions.
column4: [From.GetTitledName] ist sich aufgrund langjähriger medizinischer Erfahrung absolut sicher, dass Ihr Anzeichen von Schwindsucht zeigt. [From.GetSheHeCap] gibt Euch Anweisungen und besteht darauf, dass Ihr sie befolgt.
column6: [From.GetTitledName] expone que [From.GetHerHis]s amplia experiencia médica [From.GetHerHim] lleva a la conclusión de que has contraído Tisis. [From.GetSheHeCap] insiste que sigas [From.GetHerHis]s instrucciones.

column2: [From.GetTitledName] is sure you are developing the Saxon Plague. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.
column3: [From.GetTitledName] a la conviction que vous avez la consomption. [From.GetSheHeCap] insiste pour que vous suiviez ses instructions.
column4: [From.GetTitledName] ist sich sicher, dass Ihr Anzeichen von Schwindsucht zeigt. [From.GetSheHeCap] gibt Euch Anweisungen und besteht darauf, dass Ihr sie befolgt.
column6: [From.GetTitledName] está seguro/a que has contraído Tisis. [From.GetSheHeCap] insiste que sigas [From.GetHerHis]s instrucciones.

column2: [From.GetTitledName] hesitantly suggests you are probably developing the Saxon Plague, or something like that. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.
column3: [From.GetTitledName] suggère avec hésitation que vous avez probablement la consomption, ou quelque chose du genre. [From.GetSheHeCap] insiste pour que vous suiviez ses instructions.
column4: [From.GetTitledName] zieht zögerlich in Erwägung, dass Ihr möglicherweise Anzeichen von Schwindsucht oder etwas Ähnlichem zeigen könntet. [From.GetSheHeCap] gibt Euch Anweisungen und besteht darauf, dass Ihr sie befolgt.
column6: [From.GetTitledName] sugiere dudoso/a que puede que hayas contraído Tisis o algo parecido. [From.GetSheHeCap] insiste que sigas [From.GetHerHis]s instrucciones.

column2: A Romano-Gallic scholar recently arrived in [Root.Capital.GetName]. Your guards report that, under the guise of providing free medical examinations, this '[recruited_physician_target.GetFirstName]' had used the opportunity to preach the Gospel of Mani! The guards locked [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] up for [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHis] own good, but perhaps [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] could work as your physician?
On [GetDateText], word reached us that the dreaded Plague of Justinian has arrived in Western Europe
On [GetDateText] word reached us that Gaul has been widely depopulated by the dreaded Plague.
On [GetDateText] word reached us that Britannia has been widely Depopulated by the dreaded Plague.
On [GetDateText] word reached us that Caledonia has been widely Depopulated by the dreaded Plague.
On [GetDateText] word reached us that Hibernia has been widely Depopulated by the dreaded Plague.
On [GetDateText] word reached us that Germania has been widely Depopulated by the dreaded Plague.
On [GetDateText] word reached us that Scandinavia has been widely Depopulated by the dreaded Plague.
Gaul Ravaged by Plague

The rivers that once brought trade, wealth, and prosperity to Gaul have now become carriers of death, as the dreaded Plague of Justinian ravages the region. Spreading like a wheat field set on fire, the countryside of the afflicted areas have been left haunting and desolate, with the cities faring no better.
Britannia Ravaged by Plague

Trade routes from the south have brought death and devastation to Britannia, as the Yellow Plague strikes down kings and peasants alike. The old Roman cities of Britannia are now lined with the bodies of the dead, with some completely abandoned and now seen as cursed.
Caledonia Ravaged by Plague

Not even the hardiest of the Celts can resist the terrors of the Plague, as it reaks havoc over the highlands of Caledonia. Farms, villages, and forts that once dotted the highlands now lie fallow and abandoned, their former inhabitants having been killed and the few survivors fled.
Hibernia Ravaged by Plague

The Plague has spread across Hibernia, reaping its victims from across the Emerald Isle. Not even the men of God have been spared from this scourge, as churches and monasteries are overwhelmed by the dead and struggle to replace the dying monks and bishops ministering to the numerous dead and dying.
Germania Ravaged by Plague

A dark shadow has spread from the Rhenus to the Albis as the Plague rages across Germania. Tribe after tribe celebrates the ravage of their neighbours, only to be decimated when the plague arrives a short while later. The only thing that propers are the great funeral pyres, swelled by the ranks of the Plague's victims.
Scandinavia Ravaged by Plague

Not even the cold, northern lands of the Norse have been spared from the terrors of the Plague. The sea that was once their lifeblood has now become their scourge, as the Plague arrives the harbours and spreads inland, reaping a wide path of death and despair in its wake.
